meanings.sent1: She decided to reengrave her initials on the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: The artist had to reengrave the metal plate to fix the mistake.
meanings.sent3: After the rain washed away the first carving, they had to reengrave their names on the bench.
meanings.sent4: The memories were so precious that she wished she could reengrave them in her mind forever.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tombstone was reengraved with new details to honor the fallen soldier.

meanings.definition: To carve or cut a design or inscription into a surface again.
meanings.sent1: He carefully reengraved the family crest on the shield.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler had to reengrave the wedding ring to resize it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel managed to reengrave its initials on the freshly painted fence.
meanings.sent4: Her words were etched in his heart, impossible to reengrave.
meanings.sent5: The ancient hieroglyphs were reengraved by the skilled archaeologist for preservation.
